name: Cat Fishing Multiple Choice Quiz | Words Within Words | 15 Questions

questions.text: Let's start with an easy one: thick tomato sauce.
questions.explanation:
catsup.

	I love catsup, or ketchup, on french fries, don't you?

questions.text: If you're getting married, you probably need to hire one.
questions.explanation:
caterer.

	I hired a wonderful caterer for my (first) wedding, but I hardly got anything to eat! I'll remember that next time.

catamaran.

	I thought these came from the Pacific islands, but my dictionary says India, South America, and the West and East Indies.

questions.text: There's a chrysalis in this guy's future.
questions.explanation:
caterpillar.

	I like the fuzzy black ones. I grew up in the hills of Los Angeles and zillions of them hatched each year inside our house. At least they're easy to pick up and gently place out of doors.

questions.text: A nurse will insert one if you can't go on your own.
questions.explanation:
catheter.

	If you have had personal experience with these, you know that the less said the better.

cataclysm.

	Catastrophe has 11 letters, you guys.

category.

	I wish to state categorically that I fall into the Brilliant Quiz Makers Category.

catcher.

	On geocities there's actually an exhaustive list of baseball catchers from Fred Abbot to Frank Zupo. (I myself am not a sports nut.)

questions.text: Describes a nasty gossiping person (usually a woman, though I've known men who are this way).
questions.explanation:
catty.

	Have you seen the movie The Women? It's got some majorly catty characters. (Great movie, too.)

cathartic & caterwaul.

	Catharsis comes from a Greek word meaning 'purgation, especially of the bowels.' But psychiatrists co-opted the word when they figured out it was good for people to bring their grief and fears and so on to the surface.

Catholic.

	Does a bear __________ in the woods?

cathedral.

	While on a bike trip in Europe, the quiz maker once visited the cathedral at Chartres, France. Wow, it is absolutely breathtaking.

questions.text: One might get this way following a severe trauma.
questions.explanation:
catatonic.

	In Greek, 'kata' means 'down,' and 'tonos' means 'tension.' Actually, catatonics have periods of excitement as well as phases when they are kinda frozen.

catapult.

	Actually a slingshot is a catapult, too. Does anyone know whether the word 'pelt' has the same root?

catarrh.

	Catarrh is inflammation of a mucous membrane. So I guess snotty folks have this.
